titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William Harris et al., Indictment
CWG4454

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
CIRCUIT COURT
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST } Indictment.
William Harris, Geo Himes, William Fuller, Rice Ruark, Saml Fry, Harrison Ruark

The Grand Jury of Lewis County, in the name, and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse William Harris Geo Himes, William Fuller, Rice Ruark, Saml Fry, Harrison Ruark of the crime of grand Larceny committed as follows: The said William Harris, Geo Himes William Fuller Rice Ruark Saml Fry Harrison Ruark on the day of Sep 18663, at the County aforesaid. feloniously took and carried away, one silver watch of the value of more than four Dollars, one shotgun of the value of more than four Dollars, eight Sheets three blankets, one shall, window blinds of the value of more than four Dollars personal property, of Geo Rea against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Geo. M. Thomas
Attorney for the Commonwealth.
A Copy Test
Thos. W. Mitchel C. L. C. C.

THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
AGAINST } Indictment.
William Harris & als
Filed on the 31st day of May 1864
A TRUE BILL.
P. H. C. Bruce
Foreman.
WITNESSES FOR COMMONWEALTH.
Copy,
Examined.
